monogr.title: A glasse for housholders : wherin thei maye se, bothe howe to rule theim selfes [and] ordre their housholde verye godly and fruytfull

div.head: To the reader.
div.p: IN this small treatyse is set foorth moste wholsome councell, fyrste beyng a young man & vnmaried howe that ye should behaue your selfe, after that beyng a maried manne and an housholder, howe ye shoulde bothe rule youre selfe and ordre your houstolde, with also an exhortaciō and councell what trade and sorte your occupyeng should bee, y• is to say, y• it may be specially for y• cōmē wealth of the realme that ye are of, and also beneficial and profitable to your selfe, with many other good and wholsome lessone and counselles, whiche whosoeuer folowe, shall not only liue here a lyfe profitable both for hym selfe and all other menne, but also after this life shalbe rewarded with that croune and blisse, that God the father for Christ his sonnes sake hath promysed to theim that are his. *
